result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacey M Hutterer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court IMPOSES a sentence of 3 1/2  years of imprisonment, consisting of 1 1/2 years of Initial Confinement and 2 years of Extended Supervision

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--subject to random drug and/or alcohol screening

--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent

--maintain absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)

--to submit DNA sample upon demand

-- If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY : JESO
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
[[prior to calling of case Atty. Klein submits a packet of certificates of completion re: programming/treatment]]
Case 15CF244 called at 11:03am [mo]
Defendant Stacey M Hutterer in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Ms.Hutterer waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court IMPOSES a sentence of 3 1/2  years of imprisonment, consisting of 1 1/2 years of Initial Confinement and 2 years of Extended Supervision
The Court STAYS this sentence and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--subject to random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription, take all prescription drugs as prescribed)
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--to submit DNA sample upon demand
--to pay costs of $268 plus the $250 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibition warnings given

recess: 11:19am
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-25-2016 11:00 am
Waiver of Prelim at 02-25-2016 11:00 am
Duplicate Original Warrant returned from JCSD
with Elements and CCS attached
Original Bond Document recieved from JESO on 2/11/16
Defendant apepared in custody, Commissioner quashed warrant on record

Case called at 1:36pm [mo]
[Commissioner Weber presiding for Branch II Intake]
Defendant Stacey M Hutterer appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody.
Attorney Jessica A Klein appear in court.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Court verifies the Defendant's date of birth
The Defendant updates address
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $500  signature bond, with conditions:
--maintain absolute sobriety, to include: no possession or ingestion of alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription
--take all prescription medications as prescribed
--no possession of drug paraphernalia, to include: needles and syringes


The Court quashes the warrant.
recess 1:43  pm. 


NEXT: Waiver of Preliminary Hearing & Plea/ Sentencing on 2/25/16 at 11:00am
